title: What are the common trance states that traders experience and how do they affect trading performance?
first_phrase: In this text, the author discusses various types of trances that traders can fall into, which can prevent them from making good decisions in trading. The trances include dissociation, hallucinations and regression hypnotic suggestions, among others. The author stresses the importance of being present and focused in the moment to make good trades. The mention of various trance states and their impact on trading can help readers understand why traders may make poor decisions despite their best efforts.

last_phrase: In conclusion, understanding and avoiding the various forms of hypnotic thinking in trading, such as distorted sensory perception, excessive focus on the past, and unrealistic expectations, is crucial for achieving success in the financial markets. By remaining mindful and staying focused on the present reality of the markets, traders can increase their chances of making profitable decisions and avoid the pitfalls of destructive trading behaviors.
